txt.en: Gladsúnu
'I would much rather you stayed here to protect Marton!'
'Surely Erkenbrand would understand. You have your duties as a Thane!'
'You should send your soldiers in your stead.'
Agelwyn
'That is not the way of things, dear wife. I will ride to battle -- for Rohan, not for Marton.'
'When we heard the Fords had fallen, we were all afraid.'
'This is larger than you and me, larger than Marton, larger even than the Westfold.'
'Dear wife!'
'Then the Orcs approached in the night, torches in their hands.'
'Do not cry! You must be strong, and lead our people in my stead, if need arises.'
'Elstan woke me and pushed me out the door, and I went with him while he raised the alarm.'
'I cannot! I am no warrior.'
'We all owe him our lives. I am grateful that my husband left him to protect us while our soldiers were gone.'
'You needn't be a warrior. I leave Elstan with you -- he is my strongest and most loyal soldier.'
'But now everyone looks to ME for answers. I cannot give any! I am no leader.'
'My husband Gladsúnu is Thane, not I.'
'I still remember the day he left....'
'My dear Agelwyn, do not fear! I will be with Erkenbrand and the lords of the Mark.'
'You may be young and inexperienced, but you are clever as can be.'
'I know you will do well.'
'It does not seem right to leave your Thane husband's town to the Orcs while he is lost at the Fords.'
'Hmph!'
'If...if the unthinkable happens, you must lead our people to Helm's Deep, Agelwyn.'
'I do not know what we should do.'
'It is the safest place in all of Rohan. Tell me that you understand!'
'I think you will find that it is clear to everyone that we drive the Orcs from Marton, my lady.'
'I understand....'
'I know you are new to acting as Thane, but I am certain you will arrive at the same conclusion in time.'
'Oh dear. Someone wishes to speak with me.'
'I only wish to advise you. The time to act is now.'
'Forgive the interruption, Lady Agelwyn.'
'It is no matter. What do you need?'
'Do you not think it is time we take back Marton?'
